newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: S.AFRICA'S REMBRANDT SET TO BUY MALBAK - REPORT.
newsitem.headline: S.AFRICA'S REMBRANDT SET TO BUY MALBAK - REPORT.

text.p: South Africa's Rembrandt Group Ltd was on Sunday reported to be set to buy Malbak Ltd in a move which would create a major new packaging group.

The Business Times said it appeared to be general knowledge in the market that Rembrandt was keen to buy Malbak and merge their packaging interests, although there has been no official comment and some analysts consider the speculation ill-informed.
Since unbundling recently, Malbak has been left predominantly as a packaging group. Its holdings are mainly 68 percent of Kohler Ltd and 64 percent of U.K-listed MY Holdings Plc .
Rembrandt has numerous packaging interests, held largely through a 30 percent holding in Printpak and a 17 percent stake in Lenco . It already has six percent of Malbak.
